page.title: 01Block 03880360 Gen.Inform'n
page.content: Block 03880360 is situated on the Cheshire/Staffordshire border 2miles east of Congleton.It is an upland area forming part of the west ridge of the Pennines.Two ridges,Congleton Edge and Long Edge run N-S.The highest point is 305m.Drainage is by many small hill streams,some to the west to Dane in Shaw Brook,others east to the River Dane and Rudyard Lake.The area is one of scattered communities of farms,smallholdings and cottages.The only village is Timbersbrook.The main industry is Upland Dairy Farming on a combination of managed grassland and rough grazing.The fields are mostly small,rectangular enclosures divided by stone walls.Many farmhouses are of 18th century date with some 15/16th century eg.Higher Overton.There are 2 pubs,3 chapels(still in use),2 shops and 2 petrol stations.
